edu.ncsu.csc216.get_outdoors.util

Class SortedLinkedList.Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.get_outdoors.util.SortedLinkedList.Node
  • Enclosing class:
    SortedLinkedList<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>

    public class SortedLinkedList.Node
extends java.lang.Object
    An inner class for the individual nodes in the linked list. Each Node stores an element E, and a reference to the next Node in the list, which may be null.
    Author:
    demills

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Node(E data, SortedLinkedList.Node next)
      Constructs a new Node, setting its stored element to the passed element and the passed Node as its reference to the next element in the list.

      boolean add(E element)
      Adds the passed element to the list in a position according to the natural ordering defined by the Comparable element's compareTo() method.
      boolean contains(E element)
      Returns whether this Node or any of its successors contain the passed element.
      E get(int index)
      Returns, without removing, the element at the specified index in the list.
      int hashCode()
      Returns a integer hash of the Node's "next" and "data" fields.

      If this Node's next element is the one being searched for, the index of this Node is returned.

      Removes and returns the element at the specified index in the list.
      int size(int index)
      Returns the current index of the node, if the next field is null.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Node

        public Node(E data,
            SortedLinkedList.Node next)
        Constructs a new Node, setting its stored element to the passed element and the passed Node as its reference to the next element in the list. Both arguments permit null parameters to be passed, but a Node(null, null) will only constructed for the list's head, a dummy element. Otherwise, all Nodes in the list will always have non-null pointer to an element.
        Parameters:
        data - the stored element.
        next - the next Node in the list.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public E get(int index)
        Returns, without removing, the element at the specified index in the list. If the index is invalid, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        index - at which to retrieve the element.
        Returns:
        returns the element at the passed index.

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(E element,
                   int index)
        If this Node's next element is the one being searched for, the index of this Node is returned. Note that the index of the zeroth element, the dummy node "head", in the linked list, is actually one. Otherwise, the method calls itself for the next node in the list, passing an incremented index value.
        Parameters:
        element - the element to search for.
        index - the index of this Node in the linked list.
        Returns:
        returns the index of the element being searched for.

      • add

        public boolean add(E element)
        Adds the passed element to the list in a position according to the natural ordering defined by the Comparable element's compareTo() method. Duplicates are not allowed to be added to the list, as determined by contains().
        Parameters:
        element - the element to add.
        Returns:
        returns true if the element was added to the list.

      • size

        public int size(int index)
        Returns the current index of the node, if the next field is null. Since the dummy "head" node is at index 0, if it has no next element, size() would return 0.
        Parameters:
        index - the index in the list of the this Node.
        Returns:
        returns the size of the list.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(E element)
        Returns whether this Node or any of its successors contain the passed element.
        Parameters:
        element - the element to check for.
        Returns:
        returns true if this Node or any successors contain the element; false otherwise.

      • remove

        public E remove(int index)
        Removes and returns the element at the specified index in the list.
        Parameters:
        index - the index at which to remove an element.
        Returns:
        the removed element.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a integer hash of the Node's "next" and "data" fields.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        returns an integer hash of the Node.
